item.title: Yelp Notes
item.description: TODO: compute common business metrics from Yelp dataset. Product deep dive Company Visit Business Model, Culture, and Vision Mission: Connect people with great local places Main source of revenue is business ads, overview of offerings here More services for businesses Want: openness, curiosity, approachable DS team has “Office hours” to facilitate communication Journal clubs and learning groups Can move to PM or ML teams Projects, Tasks, and Data Working on personalization e.

item.title: LinkedIn Notes
item.description: Company Visit Recruiter Call Graydon, sr recruiter at linkedin talks about roles, … . product team Role? mission: create economic opportunity for members of workforce. Help people, as many as possiblt. inclusivity – economic opportunity, and recommending users to recruiters. How do we deploy products that highlight and empower users to Smart Products: recommend learning products based on career progression Business side: LinkedIn really white collar dominant, need to include blue-collar workers on LinkedIn.

item.title: Product Sense
item.description: Problem Types and Strategies New Product Overall product sense is about what to build and why. Overarching goals / stage of the company Contextualize: Draw a user funnel or user flow for the specific product Draw a dashboard, then populate with platform and product metrics Overall resources https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLOhHNjZItNnM5r2JCX9KzrFH5WYWKrpAA Platform Concepts and Metrics Users User Funnel Churn, funnel analysis User Flow Traffic source: Where users come from (search, referral, … ) number new visits, percent new visits Page visits: users arriving at page Bounce rate: the percentage of visitors to a particular website who navigate away from the site after viewing only one page.

item.title: Basic Computer Science
item.description: Foundations Complexity Computational Complexity Constant Time: O(1) Logrithmic Time: O(log(n)) Polynomial Time: O(n), O(n^2), … Exponential Time: \(O(x^n)\) Data Structures Lists and Dictionaries Queues and Stacks Graphs and Trees Sorting Searching Linear Search: Binary Search Graph Search Breadth First (BFS) and queues Depth First (DFS) DFS vs BFS Examples: Pointers Algorithms TODO / Other Topics: Recursion; Dijkstra’s algorithm dynamic programming (knapsack problem, Fibonacci sequence) Functional programming Tools Git and GitHub SQL General Structure of SQL querys Aggregation functions Window functions Tricks: Resources Foundations Data type manipulation (char, string, numeric, binary, ascii) regular expressions;

item.title: Probability and Statistics
item.description: Probability Foundations Probability Rules Odds and other transformations Expectation and Variance Central limit theorem Common Tests Z test Chi-Square Linear Models ANOVA t-test Mixed Effects Models GLMs: Logistic Regression Experiment Design Objective, demand, and value Constructs, metrics, and scoping User flow and target metrics Invariants Confounding variables Precision variables Metric Validation Conditions Treatment Units Assignment Mechanism Population Cohorts Synthetic Control Groups Limitations Implementation Size Duration Temporal variation Optional stopping Estimands Effiencicy or Variance Reduction Checking assignment integrety Testing Binary or Proportions Fisher’s Z Real-Valued Regression Linear Models GLMs Emperical Variance Estimation Probability Foundations combinatorics (permutations and combinations)

item.title: Behavioral Interviewing
item.description: Principles Common Behavioral Questions “Tell me a little about your background.” Child bandits: “Tell me about the project you worked on at Insight.” “Why are you interested in a career as a data scientist?” “Tell me about your research / talk to me about your last role.” “Why are you interested in joining this company?” “Talk about a time you were on a team that struggled with effective communication.

item.title: Machine Learning
item.description: Considerations Bias-variance trade-off Overfitting and Underfitting Cost Functions and Metrics Feature Engineering Seperability Assumptions about form of relationship Unsupervised Clustering k-means Agglomerative Devisive Matrix Decomposition PCA Principle Components Analysis SVD Singular Value Decomposition Text-based LDA Latent Direchilote Analysis LSA Latent Semantic Analysis Supervised Regression Linear Support Vector Machine (SVM) Classification Naive Bayes Discriminant Analysis KNN Logistic Regression Ensemble Methods Trees and Forests Regression Classification Open ended Template Raw data structure?
